description.narrative: 1. Breeding & Hatchery training: Increase knowledge and practical skills regarding breeding & hatchery management among demonstration hatchery managers and other poultry sector stakeholders in Bangladesh. 2. Layer management training. Increase knowledge and practical skills regarding layer farm management among demonstration farm managers and other poultry sector stakeholders in Bangladesh. 3. Broiler management training. Increase knowledge and practical skills regarding broiler farm management among demonstration farm managers and other poultry sector stakeholders in Bangladesh. 4. Slaughtering, (further) processing, wastewater treatment and rendering training. Increase knowledge and practical skills regarding modern and safe slaughtering, processing, wastewater treatment and rendering practices among demonstration slaughterhouse employees and other poultry sector stakeholders. 5. Bangladeshi delegation to the Netherlands. Capacity building by organizing a mission for Bangladeshi key poultry sector stakeholders to the Netherlands, to showcase the Dutch poultry sector expertise, products and solutions and provide technical assistance program (workshops). 6. Farmer field days. Promote high-quality feed usage, share best practices and introduce economic and technically viable alternative to antibiotics usage for Bangladeshi feed millers and poultry farmers. 7. Impact tours. Capacity building by connecting Dutch and Bangladeshi poultry sector stakeholders and stimulate cooperation. Identify and screen opportunities in the Bangladeshi poultry sector.

1. Middle/operational management of (medium-sized) domestically-owned companies active in: a) Breeding & hatching (breeder farms, hatcheries). b) Farming (broiler farms, layer farms). c) Feed production (ingredients storage, premixes/concentrates, complete/compound feed). d) Processing facilities (transport, slaughterhouses, further processing facilities, waste water treatment).
2. Potential Bangladeshi entrepreneurs and investors active in/considering to enter the poultry sector: a) Related projects and support services. b) Local financial institutions.
3. Government and ministries
4. Poultry related associations
5. Knowledge Institutes
6. Local sector experts
7. Bangladeshi consumers of poultry meat and eggs

Adequately plan, prepare, align and coordinate the knowledge transfer and capacity building activities which will mostly kick-off after the establishment of the demonstration facilities. Additionally, the delegation to the Netherlands will be prepared. Knowledge transfer activities include: 1. Breeding & Hatchery training. 2. Layer management training. 3. Broiler management training. 4. Slaughtering, (further) processing, wastewater treatment and rendering training. 5. Bangladeshi delegation to the Netherlands. 6. Farmer field days. 7. Impact tours. 8. Stakeholder dinner & events.
